links.title: More Uncertainty as Stocks Keep Bouncing Up and Down
links.description: The U.S. stock market indexes lost between 0.7% and 1.5% on Wednesday, as the investors' sentiment worsened again. The S&P 500 index remains close to 2,700 mark and it currently trades 6.0% below the January's 26th record high of 2,872.87.

links.title: Apple Gets Second Supplier for OLED iPhone Screens
links.description: Apple Inc. is close to getting its first batch of organic light-emitting diode screens from South Korea's LG Display Co., according to people familiar with the matter, a key step in the U.S. company's push to reduce iPhone costs and its dependence on Samsung Electronics Co.

links.title: Wireless Power Is Coming
links.description: Mobile World Congress is one of those events that make you realize the thin line between civilization and barbarism is the width of a single charging cable. Anyone who's attended MWC (or any massive trade show) is familiar with the creeping dread caused by watching your phone's battery power seep away over the course of a very long workday.

messages.body: $AAPL Apple Pay for the win
$WATT https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2018/06/28/1530816/0/en/Energous-Partners-with-IDT-to-Launch-WattUp-Near-Field-Wireless-Charging-2-0.html $AAPL $AMD $FB $TSLA $FIT $UAA

links.title: Energous Partners with IDT to Launch WattUp Near Field Wireless Charging 2.0
links.description: Cost-effective, production-ready transmitter solution supports a variety of customer applications including hearing aids, fitness trackers, smartwatches, wireless earbuds and more SAN JOSE, Calif., June 28, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Energous Corporation (NASDAQ: WATT), the developer of WattUp ®, a revolutionary wire-free, power-at-a-distance charging technology, today announced the availability of a cost-effective WattUp Near Field wireless charging transmitter solution through its partnership with IDT International Limited, a leading global electronics manufacturer.

$AAPL Apple has reached an agreement with Samsung to settle a nearly decade-long legal battle. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-apple-inc-aapl-and-samsung-finally-settle-long-running-lawsuit/

links.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) And Samsung Finally Settle Long-Running Lawsuit
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has come to a legal agreement with Korean electronics giant Samsung to settle an old lawsuit that went all the way to the Supreme Court. The two firms notified a San Jose district court that "they have agreed to drop and settle their remaining claims and counterclaims in this matter."

links.title: Facebook might not spy on you now, but it has a patent for the ability
links.description: It's not uncommon for people to think that Facebook is spying on their conversations when online ads appear to advertise something they discussed offline. The reality is often simply coincidence or more often based on cookies when searching online for something related.
